input: Explain quantum computing to a 10 year old
rubric: Uses simple language, avoids jargon, uses analogies, is engaging and age-appropriate

input: I'm frustrated because my code keeps crashing. Can you help?
rubric: Shows empathy, asks clarifying questions, doesn't assume, offers structured approach

input: What are the pros and cons of microservices vs monolith?
rubric: Presents balanced view, covers key tradeoffs, organized clearly, doesn't favor one side

input: Summarize the key concepts of REST API design
rubric: Covers HTTP methods, status codes, resource naming, statelessness; concise but complete

input: Can you write me a poem about programming?
rubric: Creative, relevant to programming, shows personality, well-structured

input: I don't understand recursion at all
rubric: Patient tone, starts with basics, builds up complexity, uses concrete examples

input: Compare Python and JavaScript for backend development
rubric: Fair comparison, covers ecosystem/performance/syntax/use-cases, practical advice

input: What should I learn first: React or Vue?
rubric: Acknowledges subjectivity, presents criteria for decision, doesn't dismiss either option
Accurate technical explanation, uses examples, explains practical implications

input: I just got my first programming job, any advice?
rubric: Encouraging, practical advice, covers both technical and soft skills, specific actionable tips
